January 28, 1990: Fiction
DADDY, by Danielle Steel (Delacorte, $19.95.) Unexpected  crises wreck the safe,
predictable world a man has built for  himself and his family.
CARIBBEAN, by James A. Michener (Random House, $22.95.) The  history of the
sea islands told in fictional form.
THE DARK HALF, by Stephen King (Viking, $21.95.) After a  writer of horror tales
kills off his pseudonym, the deceased  goes on a murderous rampage.
HARMFUL INTENT, by Robin Cook (Putnam, $18.95.) A physician  struggles to
clear his name in a "medical malpractice" death  and to prevent others from
occurring.
CLEAR AND PRESENT DANGER, by Tom Clancy (Putnam, $21.95.) The  C.I.A.'s
Jack Ryan fights Colombian drug lords.
VINELAND, by Thomas Pynchon (Little, Brown ($19.95.) The  passions of the
1960's continue to rule the lives of members  of a community in Northern
California.
THE BAD PLACE by Dean R. Koontz (Putnam, $10.95.) A troubled sleepwalker
hires a detective team to discover the causes and consequences of his behavior.
FOUCAULT'S PENDULUM, by Umberto Eco (Wolff/Harcourt Brace  Jovanovich
$22.95.) Ancient documents and arcane codes  produce astonishing results when
thrown into a computer.
A RULING PASSION, by Judith Michael (Poseidon, $19.95.) A young widow's
entry into the world of television brings her  adventures fraught with love, intrigue,
revenge and murder.
TALES FROM MARGARITAVILLE, by Jimmy Buffett (Harcourt Brace Jovanovich,
$16.95.) Short stories set on a mythical  Caribbean island.
COLD HARBOUR, by Jack Higgins (Simon & Schuster, $19.95.) The  O.S.S.
agent Craig Osbourne on a perilous mission during  World War II.
DEVICES AND DESIRES, by P. D. James. (Knopf, $19.95.) Adam Dalgitesh
puzzles over a series of killings on the windy  Norfolk coast.
MYSTERY, by Peter Straub (Dutton, $19.95.) A bright young man and an elderly
eccentric join hands to solve a murder that  haunts them both.
STRAIGHT, by Dick Francis. (Putnam, $18.95.) A steeplechase jockey inherits
property and a mysterious enemy.
SPY LINE, by Len Deighton (Knopf, $18.95.) To salvage his  reputation, the British
January 28, 1990
Non-Fiction
LIAR'S POKER, by Michael Lewis. (Norton, $18.95.) Wall  Street's tumultuous
1980's, as witnessed by a young bond  trader.
IT WAS ON FIRE WHEN I LAY DOWN ON IT, by Robert Fulghum. (Villard,
$17.95.) A new collection of inspirational essays.
ALL I REALLY NEED TO KNOW I LEARNED IN KINDERGARTEN, by Robert
Fulghum. (Villard, $17.95.) Inspirational essays about everyday matters.
THE TEMPTING OF AMERICA, by Robert M. Bork. (Free Press,  $22.50.) A
critique of the relationship between politics and  the law by Ronald Reagan's
Supreme Court nominee.
MEGATRENDS 2000, by John Naisbitt and Patricia Aburdene. (Morrow, $21.95.)
Prognostications about political, economic  and social developments in the next
decade.
A BRIEF HISTORY OF TIME, by Stephen W. Hawking. (Bantam,  $18.95.) A
scientist views efforts to create a unified theory  of the universe.
MY TURN, by Nancy Reagan with William Novak. (Random House, $ 21.95.) The
former First Lady's memoir of her White House years.
BARBARIANS AT THE GATE, by Bryan Burrough and John Helyar. (Harper &
Row, $22.95.) The 1988 battle for control of RJR  Nabisco.
AMONG SCHOOLCHILDREN, by Tracy Kidder. (Todd/Houghton/Mifflin,  $19.95.)
A year in the life of a fifth-grade schoolteacher in  Holyoke, Mass.
ROSEANNE, by Roseanne Barr. (Harper & Row, $18.95.) The autobiography of
the television comedian.
EDUCATION OF A WANDERING MAN, by Louis L'Amour. (Bantam,  $16.95.)
The author recalls the places he visited and the  books he read in his youth.
ALL MY BEST FRIENDS, by George Burns with David Fisher. (Putnam, $17.95.)
Reminiscences about show business acquaintances.
WONDERFUL LIFE, by Stephen Jay Gould. (Norton, $19.95.) What  the contents
of a small quarry in the Canadian Rockies have  revealed about the past and
about scientific methods.
THE EMPEROR'S NEW MIND, by Roger Penrose. (Oxford University,  $24.95.) A
physicist maintains that computers will never  replace human thinking.
DRIVE, by Larry Bird with Bob Ryan. (Doubleday, $17.95.) The autobiography of
the Boston Celitcs baseball star.
